byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Mandera, and Jeffrey Gettleman from Nairobi.
byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN

abstract: Kenyan authorities attempt to identify what led promising law student Abdirahim Abdullahi to join Shabab and participate in deadly shooting attack at Garissa University College; Abdullahi was son of local chief but family had not heard from him in year before attack.
lead_paragraph: Abdirahim Abdullahi was considered “bright, hardworking and polite,” so news that he was one of four gunmen who killed nearly 150 people at a university has stunned his mother and six siblings.

headline.main: Kenyans Try to Trace a Student’s Path to Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Kenyans Try to Trace a Student’s Path to Terrorism

snippet: Abdirahim Abdullahi was considered “bright, hardworking and polite,” so news that he was one of four gunmen who killed nearly 150 people at a university has stunned his mother and six siblings.
